required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Cocktail Interaction Study of St. John's Wort Dry Extract Ze 117
clinical_study.official_title: Drug Cocktail Interaction Study to Investigate the Effect of St. John's Wort Dry Extract Ze 117 on Several Cytochrome P450 Enzymes and on Transporter P-Glycoprotein in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This Study evaluates the Effect of St. John's Wort dry Extract Ze 117 on Several Cytochrome P450 Enzymes and on Transporter P-Glycoprotein in Healthy Volunteers.

detailed_description.textblock:
Current data indicate that St. John's wort preparations may induce hepatic cytochrome P450 enzymes and transport proteins. This can result in drug interactions.
The study design is standard for DDI studies and is based on the regulatory guidance of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and of the European Medicines Agency (EMA).
A cocktail approach involving the administration of multiple cytochrome P450 (CYP)- or P-glycoprotein (P-gp)-specific probe drugs is used to simultaneously assess the activities of these enzymes and the transporter P-gp.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the Plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC0-t)
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic Parameter AUC0-t (mg*h/L) of the probe drugs will be determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the Plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC0-inf)
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic parameter (mg*h/L) of the probe drugs and their metabolites will be determined.
Pharmacokinetic Parameter (ng/ml) of the probe drugs and their metabolites will be determined.
Pharmacokinetic Parameter (h^−1) of the probe drugs and their metabolites will be determined.
Pharmacokinetic Parameter (h) of the probe drugs and their metabolites will be determined.

arm_group.description: One-sequence, Probe drug cocktail alone and in combination with Ze 117.

intervention.description: Subjects will be hospitalized to receive a probe drug cocktail alone and in combination with Ze 117.
intervention.other_name: St. John's wort dry extract Ze 117

intervention.description: Subjects will be hospitalized to receive a probe drug cocktail alone and in combination with Ze 117.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- written informed consent
- Caucasian male or female subjects aged between ≥18 and ≤55years
- Physically and mentally healthy
- BMI between ≥19 and ≤29 kg/m2, and body weight ≤90 kg
- Non-smoker
- If female, the pregnancy test at screening and at admission must be negative
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known or suspected hypersensitivity to study drugs
- history of, any clinically significant diseases
- Positive test of hepatitis B, hepatitis C or HIV Screening
- Known photohypersensitivity
